intro: Dissochaeta axillaris, commonly known as the axillary dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
